property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: If a shadow card with shadow effect has not been dealt to the first attacking Orc enemy engaged with a player during combat phase, deal that enemy an aditional shadow card until dealing him a shadow card with an effect.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Surge. Immune to player card effects.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Deal X shadow cards to this attacker. X is the number of Dark Forest locations in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Dark Wolves is dealt a shadow card with effect, deal Dark Wolves an additional shadow card.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it another shadow card.

property.name: Text
property.value: While there is an Orc enemy engaged with a player, event cards cost 1 additional matching resource to play from that player's hand.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

property.name: Text
property.value: If there is an Orc enemy in the staging area, Hunter gets +2 Û and +2 Ú.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û and +1 Ú.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Archery X. X is the number of allies in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: Ir Marauder of the Hills damages a character, that character's controller must choose and discard an attachment he controls.

property.name: Text
property.value: When revealed: Return each engaged Orc enemy in play to the staging area. Orc Patrol cannot leave the game while there is other Orc enemy in play that is not another copy of Orc Patrol.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Archery X. X is the number of Orc enemies in the staging are.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player deals 1 damage to a character he controls for each Orc enemy engaged with him.

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the number of players in the game. While there is a Mountain or Wasteland location in the staging area, Rock Mercenaries cannot engage or be engaged.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Seekers of Prey is in the staging area, each Wild enemy gets +1 Û, +1 Ú and +1 Ò

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Skilled Fighter gets -1 Ú for each resource token on him.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After an attack against Skilled Fighter is resolved, place 1 resource token on him for each character that participated in that attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: If there is an Orc enemy engaged with the first player, Swift Riders engages that player.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: After this attack resolves, attacking enemy engages the next player, if able.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is double of the number of players in the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Abrupt Undergrowth, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number the first player decides.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Beorning Stream, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Cache, the first player may choose up 2 Creature enemies in play. Discard the chosen enemies.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Carrock Road, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or draw 2 cards.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Defending player must discard 1 ally card from his hand, if able.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to East Path, the first player may choose a location from the staging area and discard it, or add 1 resource to each of his heroes' resource pool.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location. Forced: After traveling to Inhospitable Places, search encounter deck for 1 Creature enemy (2 Creature enemies if 3 or more players in the game), and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Mysterious Cave leaves play as an explored location, each player may search the top 5 cards of his deck for 1 card and add it to his hand. Shuffle the rest of the searched cards back into their owners' decks.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is 1 (or 2 instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After traveling to Old Pathway, the first player may choose a Dark Forest location from the staging area. Discard the chosen location.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Discard 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player removes 1 resource from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Discard all allies in play. This effect cannot be canceled.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each Orc enemy gains Archery 1. Forced: After traveling to South Wilderlands, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, discard the top card of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, and add it to the staging area.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Deal 2 damage to a character controlled by the defending player.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Hunt X. X is the number of players in the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each Dark Forest location in the staging area gets +1 $ until the end of the phase.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending player.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach this card to the hero with the most progress tokens. Search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for all copies of Archaic Find, and remove them from the game. Then shuffle the encounter deck. This effect cannot be canceled. Response: After a hero is damaged, cancel the damage and remove all progress tokens from attached hero. Limit once per game.

card.name: The Trial of the Dark Forest

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Remove and shuffle the Wild enemies into a Orcs from Dark Forest deck and set it aside face down. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. Each player reveals 1 card from the top of the encounter deck and adds it to the staging area.

alternate.name: The Trial of the Dark Forest

property.name: Text
property.value: After an Orc enemy is destroyed by an attack, place 1 progress token on any 1 character that participated in that attack. Forced: At the end of the round, each player discards from play all allies he controls. If one hero leaves play, the players have lost the game. If each hero in play has 2 or more progress tokens on him and the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: At the beginning of the next encounter phase, discard a card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area until there is X enemies in play. X is double or more of the number of players in game. This effect cannot be canceled.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach this card to any hero with the Ranged keyword without a copy of Confusing Guidance attached. Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'The attached hero cannot attack enemies engaged with other players'. If Confusing Guidance has not been attached to any hero, it gains Surge.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, players cannot declare more than 1 attacker agains one target enemy.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacker enemy cannot be declared as target of any attack until the end of the phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Camp location is discarded. Reveal and add the Camp location to the staging area. After reveal 1 card from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add it to the staging area.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player must remove 2 progress tokens from 1 hero he controls or exhaust 1 hero he controls. Then, remove 1 progress token from the quest card for each exhausted hero in play.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Remove 1 progress token of any hero the defending player controls.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player must discard 1 attachment he controls and remove 1 progress token from any hero he controls, if able.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Return all Wild enemies in play to the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then shuffle the Orcs of Dark Forest deck. Then, discard X cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. X is the number of enemies moved by this effect. Any player may remove 1 progress token from one hero he controls to reduce the X number by 1.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunting X Keyword. After a location with the hunting keyword leaves play as an explored location, reveal X cards from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck and add them to the staging area. X is the specified value in that location. If a Wild enemy card would be discarded without being defeated, it is placed in the encounter deck discard pile. If a location with hunting leaves play as an explored location and there are no cards left in the Orcs of Dark Forest deck, then the hunting keyword has no effect.

property.name: Text
property.value: Risk X Keyword. When a location with the risk keyword is in play at the end of the combat phase, discard cards from the top of the Orcs of Dark Forest deck equal to the specified value. If the total of the discarded card’s Û is higher than the total of all ready characters’ Ò in play, the discarded cards engage the first player. If there are any risk locations in play, only the risk keyword with the highest value is considered to be active.
